content.description:
Arma virumque1 cano, Troiae qui primus ab oris 
Italiam, fato profugusprofugus, -a, -um, adj.: fugitive, LaviniaLavinius, -a, -um, adj.: Lavinian, relating to the town of Laviniumque venit 
litora, multum ille et terris iactatus et alto 
vi superumsuperum = superorum saevae memoremmemor, -oris, adj.: unforgetting Iunonis ob iram; 

Line 5multa quoque et bello passus, dum conderet urbem, 
inferretinfero, -ferre = fero, ferreque deos Latio, genus unde LatinumLatinus, -a, -um, adj.: Latin, of Latium, 
AlbaniAlbanus, -a, -um, adj.: Alban, relating to the town of Alba Longaque patres, atque altae moenia Romae.

Aeneid 1.1-7
 1:Virum refers to Aeneas.↩
content.question:
Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words.
In 3 to 4 complete sentences, identify one and only one thing that Aeneas has suffered in his quest, as described in lines 1-5 (Troiae...passus). Explain how the passage emphasizes the severity of this suffering. 
In your response you should do the following:

Respond to the prompt with an interpretation.

Include at least one specific Latin citation from the passage. Provide the Latin and/or cite line numbers and translate or accurately paraphrase the Latin. Refer to more than a single word in your reference.

Explain how the Latin citation(s) support(s) your response.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 3.A: Develop an interpretation of a Latin text.
